summary: This document is an email chain from February 2021 between an Epstein victim and FBI Victim Services regarding delays in reimbursing travel expenses for a November 2020 meeting. The meeting was a briefing for victims about OPR findings regarding the initial Florida case, organized by ODAG with FBI logistical assistance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the perpetrator whose victims were invited to a briefing meeting.

events.title: Victim Briefing Meeting
events.description: A meeting was held in November 2020 where victims of Jeffrey Epstein were briefed by the ODAG (Office of the Deputy Attorney General) on the findings of an OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) review regarding the initial Florida case. The FBI assisted with logistics.

keyFacts: Epstein victims were invited to a November 2020 briefing meeting organized by the ODAG to share OPR findings about the initial Florida case, with the FBI assisting on logistics.
The victim corresponding in the email chain had not been reimbursed for travel expenses to this meeting nearly three months later, citing administrative delays exacerbated by COVID-19.

The email reveals ongoing victim engagement and communication efforts by the FBI's Victim Services division following the Epstein case, but also highlights bureaucratic delays in processing reimbursements.
